description: Do Indian entertainment channels air in Nepal and Bangladesh? How much money is due to Indian broadcasters from these countries? How has the fall of the Sheikh Hasina government affected payments? Have Nepalese TV distributors pirated off Indian feeds?

title: Who is Thomas Pynchon – and why is everyone talking about One Battle After Another?
Quantum breathing, hypnotherapy: Secret behind Sundar, Sai Sudharsan's mental mastery
description: Washington Sundar and Sai Sudharsan’s recent rise in red-ball cricket is rooted not just in skill but in mental mastery. Behind the scenes, mental conditioning coach Raymun Roy has blended yoga, neuroscience, and cricket analysis into a unique framework. Techniques like quantum breathwork, hypnotherapy, and visualization have helped the duo stay calm, focused, and dominant under pressure.

title: Zubeen Garg death probe: Manager Siddharth Sharma and Singapore festival organiser arrested
description: Festival organiser Shyamkanu Mahanta and late singer Zubeen Garg’s manager, Siddhartha Sharma, have been arrested in Delhi and brought to Guwahati. Mahanta was reportedly hiding in Singapore, facing lookout notices. Assam DGP Harmeet Singh confirmed a transparent investigation, with teams deployed and a logical conclusion expected within seven days, urging public trust in the ongoing legal process.

title: Israel-Hamas peace plan: Pak sending troops to Gaza? Spotlight on 'peacekeeping force'
description: Pakistan's foreign minister announced the leadership will consider sending troops to Gaza as part of a Muslim nations' peacekeeping force under a US-backed peace deal. This initiative, unveiled by Donald Trump, proposes Hamas disarmament, hostage release, and a technocratic Palestinian government overseen by an international body, with a deadline for Hamas to accept.

description: Houthi rebels claimed responsibility for a missile strike on the Dutch-flagged Minervagracht in the Gulf of Aden, injuring two crew and setting the ship ablaze. This serious assault, outside their usual Red Sea operations, expands their campaign against shipping in response to the Gaza war, disrupting maritime traffic and highlighting regional tensions.

title: After two years, Chennai Metro Rail’s tunnel from Greenways Road to Mandaveli to be completed in October

title: Asia Cup: PCB punishes Pakistan players for defeat vs India? All NOC cancelled

title: Asia Cup: Imran Khan slams PCB chief; claims Mohsin Naqvi ruining Pak cricket
description: Pakistan Cricket Board chairman Mohsin Naqvi faced severe backlash after Pakistan's Asia Cup defeat to India. Indian players notably refused to accept the winner's trophy from Naqvi, also ACC chairman, amidst fan boos. This unprecedented incident sparked widespread calls for Naqvi's removal, with Pakistani politicians and critics alleging he destroyed cricket by sidelining talent and making politically motivated decisions.

description: J&K CM Omar Abdullah ruled out street protests for statehood restoration, citing the danger from "trigger-ready forces" after the recent Ladakh unrest. He vowed to pursue the demand politically and peacefully, prioritizing young lives over confrontation. Abdullah highlighted Leh's reversal on Article 370 abrogation, noting their initial celebration turned to regret, underscoring the shift in regional sentiment.

Wangchuk’s arrest: Wife Angmo calls anti-national claims 'blatant lies'; vows fight
description: Climate activist Sonam Wangchuk's wife, Gitanjali Angmo, vehemently condemned "blatant lies" and "baseless" anti-national narratives against him. She labeled his recent NSA arrest and transfer to Jodhpur jail a "witch-hunt" aimed at weakening his Ladakh Sixth Schedule movement. Angmo pledged to use the legal system, challenging accusers with facts, asserting they will not rest until truth prevails.

description: The Philippines, one of the world's most disaster-prone countries, is often hit by earthquakes and volcanic eruptions due to its location on the Pacific “Ring of Fire,” an arc of seismic faults around the ocean.

title: Deadline to switch from NPS to UPS now Nov 30
description: The government has extended the deadline for central government employees to switch from the National Pension System (NPS) to the Unified Pension Scheme (UPS) until November 30, 2025. This decision, prompted by a tepid initial response and recent scheme changes, allows more eligible employees, retirees, and spouses of deceased past retirees to opt for the new pension framework.

description: The practice of unqualified medical practitioners operating so-called ‘first aid centres’ has been rampant in Telangana for decades.

title: Monsoon season ends; India gets 8% more than normal rainfall - 5th highest since 2001
description: India's southwest monsoon season concluded with 8% above-normal rainfall, the fifth-highest since 2001. Conversely, East and North-East India experienced a severe deficit, recording their second-lowest rainfall since 1901. Despite localized disasters, robust rains significantly increased Kharif crop acreage, raising hopes for record foodgrain output. Above-normal rainfall is anticipated for October-December, potentially delaying the winter monsoon's onset.

title: Extremist violence dips 63% in 2023; jihadi attacks down 87% - NCRB report
description: India recorded a sharp decline in extremist, insurgent, and terrorist violence in 2023, with incidents plummeting from 446 to 163. Jihadi terrorism and North-East insurgency saw significant reductions. While overall casualties decreased, a concerning 50% rise in police and army personnel deaths was noted. Alarmingly, extremists looted 706 arms and nearly 20,000 rounds of ammunition, a dramatic increase from 2022.

title: ‘Cruelty by husband’: Crimes against women up marginally in 2023 - NCRB report
description: Crimes against women in India marginally increased by 0.7% in 2023, reaching 4.48 lakh cases, with "cruelty by husband or relatives" accounting for the largest share. The NCRB reported 29,670 rape cases, including 852 victims under 18. Uttar Pradesh recorded the highest total cases, while Delhi had the highest crime rate per lakh women.

title: Poverty biggest trigger for suicides, lack of education a catalyst - report

Over 4.4 lakh lives lost in 2023 accidents, a rise of 3%: NCRB data
description: India recorded over 4.4 lakh accident deaths in 2023. Daily, 1,217 lives were lost, a 3% rise from 2022. Traffic accidents, including road and rail, caused 45% of these fatalities. Road crashes claimed 1.74 lakh lives. Rail accidents resulted in 24,000 deaths. Sudden deaths increased by 12.3%, with heart attacks claiming 35,637 lives. Animal attacks also rose.

This campaign, extending to other cities, encourages voluntary compliance through emails, offering updated returns for recent cases and a 25% additional payment for older ones to avoid penalties.

description: Bihar's final electoral roll for the upcoming assembly elections is 7.4 crore, reflecting a 6% drop from the pre-revision count. This figure follows the Special Intensive Revision, which involved deleting 3.7 lakh ineligible names and adding 21.5 lakh new voters. The process, initially marked by 65 lakh deletions, had previously sparked significant opposition protests.

title: 26/11 attack: Chidambaram says foreign pressure blocked retaliation; BJP hits out

Chidambaram confirmed external influence on the decision.

Phoebe also shared their intense competitive streak, particularly when she introduces new boyfriends, and how she navigates being recognized as "Bill's daughter" by embracing her own identity.

title: Women's World Cup: Deepti Sharma leads India to 59-run win over SL
description: India clinched a 59-run victory against Sri Lanka in their 2025 ICC Women’s ODI World Cup opener, powered by Deepti Sharma's exceptional all-round display. Sharma (53 runs, 3/54) and Amanjot Kaur (57 runs) rebuilt India's innings after a collapse, setting a 271-run target. Indian bowlers then restricted Sri Lanka to 211, securing a crucial win despite earlier rain delays.

More than 90% companies have seen their AI investments failing, says study
description: New research identifies "workslop," poor quality AI-generated content, as the reason 95% of corporate AI investments yield no returns. This deceptive output, lacking substance, burdens employees with corrections. A survey found 40% of US workers recently received workslop. Experts advise leaders to implement clear guidelines for intentional AI use, ensuring meaningful contributions and preventing increased workload.

31 killed in Philippines: 6.9 magnitude quake jolts island nation; Bohol worst hit
description: A powerful 6.9 magnitude earthquake struck the central Philippines, claiming at least 20 lives with numbers expected to climb. The tremor caused landslides, damaged a church, and cut power. While local authorities warned of a minor sea-level disturbance, the Pacific Tsunami Warning Centre confirmed no tsunami threat, urging residents to remain cautious near coastal areas.

Accenture lays off thousands: CEO says we are 'exiting' employees
description: Accenture has reportedly laid off thousands globally, citing employees' inability to retrain for AI roles. Despite these cuts, the company plans to expand its headcount next fiscal year, aggressively building AI capabilities and training over 550,000 staff. CEO Julie Sweet confirmed 'exiting' non-AI-aligned talent, reflecting a broader tech industry trend where adapting to AI is crucial for professional relevance.
